org.remoteHome

Class SimpleSwitchDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.remoteHome.AbstractDevice
      • org.remoteHome.SimpleSwitchDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LightAlarmDevice

    public class SimpleSwitchDevice
extends AbstractDevice
implements java.io.Serializable
    Simple switch
    pn - check weather the device is up and running (ping command).
    l1o - light 1 on
    l1of - light 1 on and off after timeout period
    l1f - light 1 off
    l1co - configure light 1 to swith on when applied power
    l1cf - configure light 1 to stay off when applied power
    l1ct=nnn - configure light 1 timeout nnn = 0 to 255 minutes (0 means forever) minutes
    s - return status 3|light|power|configuredTimeout|currentTimeout
    light 0 off, 1 on
    power 0 on when applied power, 1 stay off when applied power
    onWhenMovement 1 - on when movement detected 0 no action
    configuredTimeout - no of minutes, when l1 will go off, 0 forever
    currentTimeout - current light 1 timeout in minutes, 0 - never switch off
    Quick startup:
    1. Connect to the power. 110 and 220 V AC is supported
    2. Test the communication AT+0=pn
    3. Assign the device ID: AT+a=9 Id is 9.
    4. Test the device: AT+9=s Should return back the status.
    5. Test the device: AT+9=l1o Should switch ON.
    6. Test the device: AT+9=l1f Should switch OFF.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                  int deviceId,
                  java.lang.String deviceName)

        Parameters:
        m - remote manager reference
        deviceId - deviceId assigned to this device
        deviceName - device name

        public void updateDevice()
                  throws RemoteHomeConnectionException,
                         RemoteHomeManagerException
        This method will update the values in this object from the hardware device
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with communication
        RemoteHomeManagerException - if the type of the device doesn't belongs to the answer received back.

      • configurePeriod

        public void configurePeriod(int period)
                     throws RemoteHomeConnectionException,
                            RemoteHomeManagerException
        This method will configure the period. The device will automatically switch off after defined period of time.
        Parameters:
        period - it is the timeout in minutes, till when the switch should stay on. The value should be in range (period < 0) || (period > 255), 0 - forever. This period could be configured using method
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is problem with connection
        RemoteHomeManagerException - if there is problem with the parameter value

      • switchOnWhenAppliedPower

        public void switchOnWhenAppliedPower(boolean onWhenPower)
                              throws RemoteHomeConnectionException
        This method will configure the behavior of the switch, when the power is applied.
        Parameters:
        onWhenPower - true, if the switch should go ON, when the power is applied. false, when it should stay off.
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is problem with connection
